p: During COVID-19 pandemic, like previously described in China, we faced a reduction or even a suspension of elective surgery, due to the reduction of the availability of hospital beds, especially in intensive-care units (ICUs), and an increasing number of infections between health people ( 2). Is stated, also, that COVID-19 that develops in perioperative time is a risk factor for increased length of stay, morbidity and mortality, especially in thoracic surgery, were the lung, is manipulated to perform parenchymal resection ( 3, 4).
